intro: Phlegmariurus cancellatus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser zigzag moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its intricate, branching structure and small, oval-shaped leaves that are often arranged in a zigzag pattern. This moss thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found on rocks or soil in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on stalks and release spores when mature. The plant plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
